title: Remember: Taliyah is a Shuriman champion
body:
Shurima is based on the real-life Egypt

So it makes sense that she looks like an young Middle Eastern girl. In fact I would find it odd if her splash art didn't looked like what it is now. She is pretty beautiful to be honest

replies.body: I feel this is important to say, but Shurima is based on the popular _interpretation_ of ancient Egypt.
Super fantasy Egypt.  Just like how Ionia is super fantasy Asia and the Freljord is super fantasy Russia/Norway/Sweden/Scandinavia.
Hmm. Demacian would probably be super fantasy medieval Europe, I wonder what Noxus would be

> [{quoted}](name=Jelly Mac,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=1I3NJKfM,comment-id=000600000000,timestamp=2016-05-04T16:57:29.667+0000)
>
> Hmm. Demacian would probably be super fantasy medieval Europe, I wonder what Noxus would be

Super Fantasy Medieval Europe that many people don't want to acknowledge.


I mean, I see both as European.  One "bright and shiny" the other one "Dark and foreboding".  Just that each side has its own ups and downs.  You know?
Yeah, Noxus and Demacia are the two sides of Europe: shiny, happy, righteous, and just. Then there's the cruel, ruthless, harsh, dark, and 3spooky5me cutthroat side of it.

Demacia is the Aristocratic side of europe, kind of like pre-revolutionary France. It's full of people that pretend like their entire lives are perfect and morally just while murdering anyone who disagrees.

Noxus is the kind of more lower-class Europe, or the post-revolutionary countries, where the power of the many was used to instate new laws based on unpolished democracy.

I feel like they are more like Greece that has been transplanted into the Germanic parts of Europe. Demacia, seen as a beacon of hope and morality (Blue as their main color) vs. Noxus, seen as strong yet overly bloodthirsty (Red as their color). 

{{champion:86}} Principles mean everything vs. {{champion:122}} Strength means everything

Seems like Athens vs. Sparta to me

This is a closer example. Demacia has a very clear fusion of Bushido/chivalry as their honor system.  Personal honor and principle are the core, while Noxus values strength, even duplicitous and dishonorable strength. 

Noxus would execute non combatants to pull people into a direct conflict. 

Demacia woul not, but ultimately both expect success regardless.

I dunno. I see Noxus as a super extreme form of the American Dream. They have this ideal that being strong and working will get you far ahead. Not to say other countries don't have those sorts of ideals, but I feel like the American Dream is the most stereotypical of that. Not to call the US Noxus. It's done good, and it's done bad, just like basically every country ever. I think it also exemplifies a bit of imperialistic nations as a whole. The war with Ionia vs. colonization of all of the Americas and various other continents is also a good connection. Except many many countries in Europe and later the US as well practiced imperialism.
Ehhh, more like Social Darwinism gone mad then specifically America in my opinion.
Meh, if anything, I'd say Great Britain
I'd say Britain was wayyyy more imperialistic though. Those Opium Wars tho
I like to think they are both since both sides have German and French names.  But if I had to make a choice, I'd say Demacia is France and Noxus is Germany.
Noxus is like nazi
that is the single worst interpretation of league lore that i have ever had the displeasure of actually reading words that a person actually thought to actually say on the boards, like actually

I'd have to 100% agree. I mean in Noxus, the strong survive. In Nazi Germany, the Aryans and those who don't question the Nazi regime survived. Huge difference. Noxus is NOWHERE nearly as brutal as Nazi Germany.

> [{quoted}](name=Spizzle9000,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=1I3NJKfM,comment-id=0006000000000000000000000001,timestamp=2016-05-04T19:49:09.661+0000)
>
> I'd have to 100% agree. I mean in Noxus, the strong survive. In Nazi Germany, the Aryans and those who don't question the Nazi regime survived. Huge difference. Noxus is NOWHERE nearly as brutal as Nazi Germany.

The only thing that possibly resembles the Nazi in the League history is the Noxian invasion and massacre of Ionia. And even then I would say it is more based on the Empire of Japan history.

Exactly. Personally, I'd say if anything, Noxus is Japan in this situation if you look at Japan invading Manchuria and also the area which is currently Korea (the former was a bit before WW2 and the latter during Teddy Roosevelt's presidency).
^ lmao
If Noxus and Demacia are Europe, Zaun and Piltover are the USA. Piltover representing the West-coast high-tech utopian vibe, and Zaun representing all of America if Trump is elected.
+1. The popular interpretation of ancient Egypt is as fictional as Shurima itself.

Shurima does not = any middle eastern countries

Besides, if that were the case, then we would have already seen the new opposition faction called the Inhibitor State of Ionia and Shurima (ISIS for short), in which case there would have been several bombings in Demacian theaters and airports, but we wouldn't want that in the lore would we :/
You are confusing conflicts with Locations here.
Why you gotta make it racist? Was that really necessary?
That's not racist in the slightest.

no no, it is. confusing terrorists and race is racist. I mean, do you think we should still call native americans savages?

hint, if you said yes to that you are racist.

DAS RACIST

*Wipes saliva off chin*

No, but it's a desert nation with many similarities to Egypt. However, the important thing is climate and environment, which usually dictate skin tone. Note that her facial features themselves are almost ambiguous. It's a little hard to say if they definitively look like anything else, however, her skin tone is definitely the appropriate golden brown tone.
I don't have a clue why ISIS would need to be featured here.
I honestly don't see why people don't like her appearance.  It's much more unique than someone like {{champion:21}}. I think it's cute.

For a second I thought you were saying that MF was cute.

You know, one of the champions I absolutely despise in LoL.

> [{quoted}](name=Melledoneus,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=1I3NJKfM,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2016-05-04T20:24:57.898+0000)
>
> For a second I thought you were saying that MF was cute.
> 
> You know, one of the champions I absolutely despise in LoL.

Nah.  She's pretty annoying vocally & kit-wise.

"sigh," For me its {{champion:40}} i hate her design but i play her cause she is good at her (support) job.

Oh i also hate how she screws over the sun if played right...

For me, it's {{champion:25}}.  Long snare, AoE spell that can easily proc TLD, stun & slow from ult, and the spell shield is something that even the Heart of the Freljord can't penetrate for a few seconds.
{{champion:136}}  "You are going to kill me? Dressed like that?"  {{champion:21}}

It would make just as much sense for her not to look like middle eastern girl, as Sivir doesn't, and as at least big parts of ancient Egypt population didn't.

Face it, Taliyah looks Arabic only because someone at Rito wanted to express their oh-so-not-islamophobic worldview in times of ISIS and Refugee Crisis.

Not that it's necessarily a bad thing, but that's a fact.

First of all, Islam is a religion and not a race. Taliyah is not wearing a hijab , and from current league lore Islam is not a thing, and therefore you have no basis to deduct that it has anything to do with Islam.

Secondly, please name a single Arabic champion already existing in league.

Exactly.

Diversity is a good thing, especially when its not forced down your throat. Taliyah being an average looking Turkish girl makes perfect sense for her character. It would be very off putting if she was a belong bimbo with a snapped spine.

She's cute, quirky, and relatable to a lot of people who don't have any other characters that  they can relate to.

Stop being a dick.

Technically, Sivir is Azir's long-lost descendant. So, she is intended to be at least partially Shuriman. 

That said, due to her mercenary background and the likelyhood she travels across all of Runeterra, it's possible the rest of her family did the same if one were able to go back through her family tree, and likely found mates all over Runeterra. Which could potentially "explain" why she has a less strict Shuriman appearance than someone like Taliyah who's family has likely lived there for ages.

This is merely to explain there is, in fact, another Shuriman character (also Zilean, though being trapped in time limbo for a millennia might cause some major.. issues with both the mind and body).
Isn't Malzahar based somewhat on arabic djinn folklore? Visually, at least.

Yes, but he's more representative of the Djinni themselves, rather than the people that created the stories.

It's like how Wukong isn't really a chinese person the way other champions are. He's based on a chinese myth, but is, himself... not.
Makes sense, thanks.
Do you hear yourself talk?

No. He's typing.

But he obviously has never heard of the backspace key.

or consider that not every character riot makes has to be white? also I'm not really sure how this relates to Islamophobia, as Islam is not a race, so making her Turkish in appearance is not really making any sort of statement...
Anyone else getting a Toph Beifong from "Avatar - The Last Airbender" vibe from her, or is that just me?
A lot of people say that, but I personally see Terra from Teen Titans much more as their inspiration behind the champ.  The way her powers are and how she uses them is totally the same as Terra.

Why don't people also complain about Azir? If Taliyah is not what a pretty girl is supposed to look like in 'Murrica, then neither does Azir fit in with my 'Murrican concept of leadership birds. In 'Murrica, my inspiring bird got dem dere hwite face and dem dere browny furr, and we-a-calls him the bald eagoll. Frankly, I am offended and shaken by Rito's obvious pandering to politically correct non-'murrican leader birds. Golden birds is preposterous and unmerican.
I really don't get the hate on Taliyah's appearance, but I suspect most of it comes from sheltered bumblefucks.
Ok, idk people was complaining about her physics O.o I think she is cute and definitely matches the character's origin, her ingame design looks soo pretty! the flow of her movements is great.
Has anyone actually complained about her appearance?
